{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3354388,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T23:24:25.742Z","cooked":"

Hey,

I am curious what the best April Tag detection setup is in 2024.

My team has never used vision before and in the 2024 offseason we want to look into it. We have heard a lot about the limelight and see the 2 options of limelight 3, or 3g and are not sure if those are the best options.

We want to be able to detect April Tags with lots of degree fast and accurately.

Is limelight the way to go? If so which one? How many is a good amount for a robot without causing issues?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T23:24:25.742Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":269,"reads":364,"readers_count":363,"score":1417.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461625,"topic_slug":"limelight-in-2024","display_username":"Eric1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-in-2024/461625/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3354389,"name":"Marshall Tappen","username":"MTappen","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/aca169/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T23:28:59.615Z","cooked":"

Our team was new to vision and the simplicity of the Limelight made it much easier to get things working. We could get results without much fiddling, which got the students excited.

I would recommend investing in an Orange Pi 5 and using an Arducam OV9281. You can install PhotonVision on the Orange Pi, and it will give you much more processing speed for only a fraction of the price.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T23:33:03.152Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":340,"readers_count":339,"score":133.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461625,"topic_slug":"limelight-in-2024","display_username":"Nadav","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://a.co/d/clImPqz","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":32},{"url":"https://a.co/d/hqRPOV5","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com","clicks":25}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57374,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"353 Alum | Elastic"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-in-2024/461625/3","custom_user_title":"353 Alum | Elastic","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3354417,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T23:54:14.530Z","cooked":"

We have used both PhotonVision and Limelight setups for pose estimation the past couple of years.

2023 we used PhotonVision on a limelight 2+. We initially tried limelights software and had jittering and accuracy issues. Photon worked great since we could filter stuff better. We also found we got better performance with photon.

2024 we got a Orange Pi and Arducam setup metioned above by @Gold87. We liked the performance of the Orange Pi as well as the cost to performace ratio. Ultimately we had to switch to Limelight as we had what we believe was a static issue killing Orange Pi’s. This didn’t seem to be a common problem so don’t take that as a reason to not go this route.

2024 Limelight change. Limelight was great this year. We got alot better reliability and the updates limelight added to check ambiguity, distance and tag count have been big to getting better pose estimation with limelight.

Looking forward to 2025 and limelight. Introducing MegaTag2 by Limelight Vision This latest update appears to be some next level stuff but I have no personal experience to add about this.

Limelight 3 vs 3g. We started the season using our 3 that was supposed to be for intake but got switched after our Orange Pi issues. The 3 was okay but had some issues flickering and had challenges with a shaded april tag at our first event. We got a 3g before our second event and it worked great. If you are using it for april tag detection only I would get a 3g over the 3. Keep in mind you cannot use the 3g for google coral detection.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T23:54:14.530Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":317,"readers_count":316,"score":118.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461625,"topic_slug":"limelight-in-2024","display_username":"Smtopps","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/introducing-megatag2-by-limelight-vision/461243","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Introducing MegaTag2 by Limelight Vision","clicks":41}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33408,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-in-2024/461625/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3387092,"name":"Adithya Anand","username":"Adithya_Anand","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adithya_anand/{size}/208753_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-16T17:29:53.897Z","cooked":"

This year, we (team 177) pretty much exclusively used limelights. We had 1 under the shooter (for tracking speaker), 2 on the sides (for tracking amp/source), 1 on the intake (for tracking source/stage in auto), and another on the intake (for note detection). We used 3gs for apriltag tracking and a 3+coral for note detection.

It worked extremely well for us, especially with megatag 2 and being able to exclude certain tags that we felt were incorrect. Our pose estimation was very accurate after tuning standard deviations and decent throwout logic (this is one of the most crucial factors in a good vision system).

The advantage with limelights is that it is generally very quick to get set up and started. LimelightLib is pretty easy to use, and it isn’t hard to get a simple apriltag tracking system working reliably. However, they are $400 each, and the performance isn’t amazing (we were only able to get around 15-20 fps at the high res pipeline). PhotonVision comparatively, should be cheaper with better performance, and you can run multiple cameras from a single coproccessor. There is also a good API for it, so while it might not be as easy to set up as an LL, it shouldn’t take too long to get it working. However, there have been some problems that we have seen (your mileage may vary) like frequently disconnecting USB cameras. I cannot completely attest to this, as we haven’t used PV on an actual competition robot, but there are plenty of teams that have.

Overall, they are both great options, and the ultimate decision will depend on many factors, like budget, and the amount of time you want to spend with it.

We are currently also looking into using a custom solution for tracking apriltags, (built from 6328’s Northstar), but I wouldn’t recommend this route to anyone just getting started with apriltag tracking, as it is fairly complex, and the payoffs of this compared to the previously mentioned vision solutions aren’t that big in regard to the amount of time it would take to get it to work.
